segments.text: The first thing I notice is the adult woman standing there, lost in her dish-drying task.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: There’s a sense of routine about her actions, but it feels so disconnected from the chaos around her.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can't help but feel frustrated at how oblivious she is to the overflowing sink.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The puddle at her feet is spreading, yet she seems completely at ease.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: She’s in her own world while everything around her is falling apart.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: And then there are the kids, sneaking their cookies, riding a wave of thrill and danger.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It’s an innocent kind of mischief, but I worry about what might happen next.
segments.speaker: PAR
